name: Exfiltration to Code Repository
description:
Adversaries may exfiltrate data to a code repository rather than over their primary command and control channel. Code repositories are often accessible via an API (ex: https://api.github.com). Access to these APIs are often over HTTPS, which gives the adversary an additional level of protection.

Exfiltration to a code repository can also provide a significant amount of cover to the adversary if it is a popular service already used by hosts within the network.
x_mitre_detection: Analyze network data for uncommon data flows (e.g., a client sending significantly more data than it receives from a server) to code repositories. Processes utilizing the network that do not normally have network communication or have never been seen before are suspicious. User behavior monitoring may help to detect abnormal patterns of activity.

mitigates.name: Restrict Web-Based Content
mitigates.description: Restrict use of certain websites, block downloads/attachments, block Javascript, restrict browser extensions, etc.

requirements.description: Ensure that web proxies are used to enforce an external network communication policy to prevent unauthorized use of external services.
Ensure that network monitoring solutions are configured to analyze network data for uncommon data flows.
Ensure that system is monitored for suspicious processes (do not normally have network communication) that utilizes the network.
Ensure that system is configured to monitor user behavior to detect abnormal activity patterns.
